channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jamie Dimon wants workers in the office. So why is he letting JPMorgan’s European chief work remotely?
item.description: The return-to-office double standard has sparked a conversation online: “Rules for thee but not for me.”

item.title: Block out the noise and stay invested — stock picks and advice from one of the world’s oldest mutual funds
item.description: Since launching in 1934, The Investment Company of America fund has rolled with world war and evolving economies. These are its stock picks.

item.title: ‘Everybody is in danger’ as budget cuts gut caregiving services
item.description: Labor activist Ai-jen Poo, featured in Bradley Cooper’s PBS “Caregiving” documentary, says “the story of caregiving in America is everyone’s story.”

item.title: Global stocks fall, oil futures rise, on a report U.S. may soon strike Iran
item.description: Asian and European stocks fell on Thursday, and oil futures rose, as reports suggested a U.S. military strike against Iran could happen this weekend.

item.title: GenLayer launches a new method to incentivize people to market your brand using AI and blockchain
item.description: With applications like Rally already live in beta, GenLayer presents a new category of intelligent blockchain infrastructure.

item.title: Social Security will stop sending paper checks soon. How to make sure you still get your benefits on time.
item.description: Paper Social Security checks will be eliminated on Sept. 30.
